div.p: A38, The Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Victorian Branch), Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

This evening, dear Mr Macdonald, I received your kind letter of this day,
Letter not found.
and in answer I support your view, that a sum of £10 or more be voted for the children of Mr Le Mestre, all the more so as their father gave really the first impulse to the formation of the RGSA and worked for a year or two strenuously for it, til he came into antagonism to Sir Strickland. Thursday afternoon I will make free for a Council meeting. Perhaps you could ascertain before, whether Mr Turner will or can make free £10 (or more) from our locked up fund for this appealing purpose.
Please return your kind brothers letter, as I have not yet replied. Yesterday I sent your brother, the Police-Magistrate one of my book.
